verses.verse: Wisdom <S%H2454><s%> has built <S%H1129><s%> her house <S%H1004><s%>, she has cut out <S%H2672><s%> her seven <S%H7651><s%> pillars <S%H5982><s%>:
She has killed <S%H2873><s%> her animals <S%H2874><s%>; she has mingled <S%H4537><s%> her wine <S%H3196><s%>; she has also furnished <S%H6186><s%> her table <S%H7979><s%>.
She has sent forth <S%H7971><s%> her maidens <S%H5291><s%>: she cries <S%H7121><s%> upon <S%H1610><s%> the highest places <S%H4791><s%> of the city <S%H7176><s%>,
Whoever is simple <S%H6612><s%>, let him turn in <S%H5493><s%> here <S%H2638><s%>: as for him that wants understanding <S%H3820><s%>, she says to him <S%H559><s%>,
Come <S%H3212><s%>, eat <S%H3898><s%> of my bread <S%H3899><s%>, and drink <S%H8354><s%> of the wine <S%H3196><s%> which I have mingled <S%H4537><s%>.
Forsake <S%H5800><s%> the foolish <S%H6612><s%>, and live <S%H2421><s%>; and go <S%H833><s%> in the way <S%H1870><s%> of understanding <S%H998><s%>.

He that reproves <S%H3256><s%> a scorner <S%H3887><s%> gets <S%H3947><s%> to himself shame <S%H7036><s%>: and he that rebukes <S%H3198><s%> a wicked <S%H7563><s%> man gets himself a blot <S%H3971><s%>.
Reprove <S%H3198><s%> not a scorner <S%H3887><s%>, lest he hate <S%H8130><s%> you <S%H3198><s%>: rebuke a wise man <S%H2450><s%>, and he will love you <S%H157><s%>.

Give <S%H5414><s%> instruction to a wise <S%H2450><s%> man <S%H2449><s%>, and he will be yet wiser: teach <S%H3045><s%> a just <S%H6662><s%> man <S%H3254><s%>, and he will increase in learning <S%H3948><s%>.
The fear <S%H3374><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> is the beginning <S%H8462><s%> of wisdom <S%H2451><s%>: and the knowledge <S%H1847><s%> of the holy <S%H6918><s%> is understanding <S%H998><s%>.
For by me your days <S%H3117><s%> shall be multiplied <S%H7235><s%>, and the years <S%H8141><s%> of your life <S%H2416><s%> shall be increased <S%H3254><s%>.
If you be wise <S%H2449><s%>, you shall be wise <S%H2449><s%> for yourself <S%H3887><s%>: but if you scorn, you alone shall carry it <S%H5375><s%>.
A foolish <S%H3687><s%> woman <S%H802><s%> is loud <S%H1993><s%>: she is simple <S%H6615><s%>, and <S%H1077><s%> knows <S%H3045><s%> nothing <S%H4100><s%>.
For she sits <S%H3427><s%> at the door <S%H6607><s%> of her house <S%H1004><s%>, on a seat <S%H3678><s%> in the high places <S%H4791><s%> of the city <S%H7176><s%>,
To call <S%H7121><s%> passengers <S%H5674><s%> who go right <S%H3474><s%> on their ways <S%H734><s%>:
Whoever is simple <S%H6612><s%>, let him turn in <S%H5493><s%> here <S%H2638><s%>: and as for him that wants understanding <S%H3820><s%>, she says to him <S%H559><s%>,
Stolen <S%H1589><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%> are sweet <S%H4985><s%>, and bread <S%H3899><s%> eaten in secret <S%H5643><s%> is pleasant <S%H5276><s%>.
But he knows <S%H3045><s%> not that the dead <S%H7496><s%> are there <S%H7121><s%>; and that her guests are in the depths <S%H6012><s%> of hell <S%H7585><s%>.
